p: Palm oil production has already declined because of the direct and indirect uncertainties of CC. Zainal, Shamsudin, Mohamed, and Adam ( 2012) predicted that palm oil revenue would reduce by 341.29, 127.43, and 51.80 MYR/ha for Peninsula Malaysia, Sabah, and Sarawak, respectively, by 2029. Even greater losses are predicted by 2099 for Sabah and Sarawak (294.20 and 105.62 MYR/ha, respectively) although Peninsular Malaysia was similar. Increase in temperature and rainfall resulted in 41, 49, and 38 MYR/ha decrease for Peninsular Malaysia, Sabah, and Sarawak. These figures are without adaption and mitigation strategies being taken (Zainal et al., 2012) and are to some extent confirmed by decreases in suitable climate for OP growth during similar periods (Paterson et al., 2015, 2017).
